intro: Coutoubea densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered coutoubea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers partial to full sun. Coutoubea densiflora is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and seasonal blooms.
